item.title: What a Hit Chinese TV Show Tells Us About China Today
item.description: "Blossoms Shanghai" is A 30-part TV series directed by acclaimed Hong Kong filmmaker Wong Kar-wai, set in the 1990's that has become a huge hit in China. Our China correspondent tells us the nostalgia unleashed by the show tells us a lot about how people in China are feeling these days.

item.title: A giant crane arrives in Baltimore, but leaders see a 'daunting' cleanup job ahead
item.description: Federal money and resources are flowing to Maryland as authorities scramble to remove the wreckage of the Francis Scott Key Bridge. But they acknowledge the effort will not be easy, cheap or quick.

item.title: Clearing Baltimore's shipping channel won't be easy, will take at least weeks
item.description: The likely first step will likely be securing the massive container ship that brought the bridge down on Tuesday. Then, clearing debris from the shipping channel.

item.title: Mercy me: Photos show what humans have done to the planet in the Anthropocene age
item.description: Anthropocene refers to the age of humans — the things we've done to Earth. Geologists just rejected a proposal to declare an official "Anthropocene epoch." But everyone agrees: Damage has been done.

item.title: Texas appeals court acquits Crystal Mason's illegal voting conviction
item.description: The court said the state did not have enough evidence to prove that Mason knew she was ineligible to vote when she cast a ballot in the 2016 election. She was facing a five-year prison sentence.

item.title: Louis Gossett Jr., the 1st Black man to win a supporting actor Oscar, dies at 87
item.description: Gossett won the award for An Officer And A Gentleman, and also got an Emmy for Roots. More recent prominent roles for the Broadway star and civil rights activist were in The Color Purple and Watchmen.

item.title: 'A generous man': Baltimore bridge worker helped family, community in Honduras
item.description: Maynor Suazo Sandoval left Honduras when he was 20 and built a new life in the U.S. He is one of the missing workers from the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge.

item.title: TikTok and others change platforms to protect kids. Advocates say it's just a start
item.description: A new report by Children and Screens rounds up the changes spurred by the U.K.'s Age Appropriate Design Code, which went into effect in 2020. Similar laws are being considered in the U.S.

item.title: EPA's new rules to clean up heavy trucking met with support and criticism
item.description: The EPA has finalized the strictest-ever limits on greenhouse gas emissions from heavy-duty trucks, a category that includes everything from buses to garbage trucks.

item.title: Why the University of Idaho marching band members are heroes in Connecticut
item.description: When Yale's marching band wasn't able to make it to March Madness, the Sound of Idaho stepped in — and went viral. A week later, Connecticut's governor proclaimed a "University of Idaho Day."
